uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.html

Class BaseHTMLForm

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.BaseForm
      • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.MapForm
        • uk.ac.ed.epcc.webapp.forms.html.BaseHTMLForm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Field>, Contexed, Form
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HTMLForm, PageHTMLForm

    public abstract class BaseHTMLForm
extends MapForm
    Common Base class for different types of HTML Form This class supports stateful/multi-state forms but only if the self FormResult is set when creating the form as multi-stage forms have

      • poll

        public boolean poll()
             throws TransitionException
        Description copied from interface: Form
        Attempt to show/validate the current state of the form as part of a multi-phase form. This is called during form construction when values from inputs are needed to construct the rest of the form. If the method returns true then form construction can continue. For GUI forms this may mean that a partial form has been shown and completed by the end user. If false then the method will have modified the form to add actions to progress the multi-stage completion and the form should be displayed as-is.

        If multi-stage submission is not supported the method will just return true.

        Returns:
        boolean true if form build should continue
        Throws:
        TransitionException

      • supportsMultiStage

        public final boolean supportsMultiStage()
        Description copied from interface: Form
